Meanwhile Outside the Ark
 
As Uproar and Quickstride wee hatching their ne=
w plan to get through the shield, Rodimus had been keeping an optic on his =
internal chronometer, watching the time continue to count down. 
 
As the e=
xplosion rocked the area of the Black Tower, even at this distance, all the=
se miles away, Rodimus' sensors registered a small blip, the slightest ripp=
le of the explosion. A quick calculation gave him a true estimation of the =
size. 
 
"NOW!" Rodimus said as he leaped up from their place of waiting an=
d began to run towards the shield, he holding the device in his hand. Behin=
d him Leo II, Wing Caliber and Ramulus were quickly behind him. 
 
With a q=
uick toss Rodimus sent his device hurtling towards the shield as he ran up =
to it. "Hurry, we have only a few seconds before the shielding adapts!"
 
I=
nside the Ark
 
All of the medics, Legacy, Bump, Santon and Perceptor kept =
a vigil on Nightlight, and for the moment her vitals continued to remain st=
eady and strong even in their sedated state =96 her systems were stable and=
 running under their own power now. 
 
Legacy looked up, his optic sensor g=
lowing strangely. "Facinating" he said as he stood up.
 
"What is it?" Bump=
 said as he looked over at Legacy, alarm creeping onto his face and into hi=
s voice. 
 
"I am detecting a distant seismic disturbance." Legacy said aft=
er a moment of contemplation.
 
Santon looked at Nightlight as if half expe=
cting this to be affecting her. "Where is it coming from?" he said as he no=
w turned to Legacy, for the moment confident that this seemed to have no af=
fect on their patient.
 
Legacy paused for a moment as if examining his int=
ernal records. "Unknown" he said finally. "I would need full access to the =
Ark's sensors." Legacy looked back at Santon and Bump, "However if this is =
indeed a result of Perceptor's destruction of his former base then the exlo=
sion was truly massive on a large scale."
 
* * * * * 
 
As Legacy and the =
others talked, the voice that was speaking to Elita continued talking, "Eli=
ta. I am hurt, badly hurt." It sounded like Lord Elder still, but the voice=
 was steadily getting weaker. 
 
There was the sound of crawling and shuffl=
ing. "I was ambushed and knocked unconscious." The voice paused, "Elita, wh=
ere are you?"
 

With the Maximals on the way back to the Ark!

> "Noctorro=
, Torca, I've regained sixty percent of my energy reserve.
> It should be e=
nough for me to drive on my own now. I thank you
> deeply for your assistan=
ce, and wish not to burden you any further.
> After all, towing a vehicle m=
y size and weight, must put quite a strain
> on your systems. I'd rather no=
t see that happen."

"Of course." Torca said in deep tones. "We are always =
here for the Maximals and you Autobots." His tone was grave. 

Torca and Ba=
ntor who had been the actual ones to help pull began to come to a slow halt=
. They were not fast as most vehicles go, but they were large enough. Banto=
r was perhaps fully the size of a large jungle cat, but Torca was as large =
as a woolly mammoth and looked strong enough to pull Tuscon by himself if n=
ecessary. 

Looking up Torca spoke to Noctorro, "You and Quicksilver get ba=
ck to the Ark. I think we have this under control, the Ark is the most impo=
rtant thing now."

"Sir!" They both said in unison as they both began flyin=
g off in the direction of the Ark. 

(OOC: The Maximals might notice now th=
at communications are no longer being blocked. They can communicate with ea=
ch other as well as the Ark.)
